sentence.Network_en: I've kicked cigarettes, heroin, and booze.
sentence.Network_cn: 我已经戒了烟，不再吸食海洛因和酗酒了。

sentence.Network_en: He was dry for years but now he's back on the booze.
sentence.Network_cn: 他已戒酒多年,但现在又开始喝了.

sentence.Network_en: She's been off the booze for a month now.
sentence.Network_cn: 到现在她已经一个月滴酒不沾了.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English  bouse, from Middle Dutch būsen 'drink to excess'. The spelling booze dates from the 18th cent

entry.def: If people booze, they drink alcohol.

example.ex: ...a load of drunken businessmen who had been boozing all afternoon.
example.tran: 一群整个下午都在饮酒的醉醺醺的生意人

auth_sentence.content: Dorrie got worried about all the booze he was soaking up.
auth_sentence.res_content: Dorrie got worried about all the booze he was soaking up.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Dorrie got worried about all the booze he was soaking up.

auth_sentence.content: Then a sozzled client drags him away jeering that he always steals the booze.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Then a sozzled client drags him away jeering that he always steals the booze.

auth_sentence.content: Thirteen years of bootlegging, gangsterism, booze so bad it made you go blind and by that, I do not mean blind drunk.

sentences.en: I could smell booze on his breath.
sentences.cn: 我能从他的呼吸中闻到酒味。

sentences.en: There was free booze at the party.
Her husband has been on the booze again.

sentences.en: He turned to booze when his wife died.
